      • getId

        public String getId()
        Description copied from interface: Describable
        Returns the name, aka ID, of the describable item. The name should be unique for each instance.
        Example: html for a MetacardTransformer that transforms Metacards to HTML
        Specified by:
        getId in interface Describable
        Returns:
        ID of the item

      • getTitle

        public String getTitle()
        Description copied from interface: Describable
        Returns the title of the describable item. It is generally more verbose than the name (aka ID).
        Specified by:
        getTitle in interface Describable
        Returns:
        title of the item (example: Dummy Catalog Provider)

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: Source
        This method states whether this source is available, typically connecting and performing some sort of simple query or ping to the native catalog. This is expected to be an expensive operation, possibly involving network I/O. Typically only CatalogFramework implementations will call this and only periodically.
        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface Source
        Returns:
        true - if the site is available (up), false - if the site is unavailable (down)
        See Also:
        ddf.catalog.util.SourcePoller

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(SourceMonitor callback)
        Description copied from interface: Source
        This method is the same as Source.isAvailable() but allows a caller to provide a SourceMonitor callback object which is meant to be used as a way for the Source to dynamically contact the caller with its availability. The intent is to return a boolean as to whether the Source is available at this very moment and also to use the SourceMonitor object to update the caller of this method if this Source's availability changes later in the future.
        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface Source
        Parameters:
        callback - - used to notify the caller of this method when the Source object wants to update its availability.
        Returns:
        true - if the site is available (up), false - if the site is unavailable (down)

      • query

        public SourceResponse query(QueryRequest request)
                     throws UnsupportedQueryException
        Specified by:
        query in interface Source
        Parameters:
        request - the query to execute
        Returns:
        a SourceResponse with query results and query response details
        Throws:
        UnsupportedQueryException - when the query is not understood, malformed, or not supported by a Source

      • getContentTypes

        public Set<ContentType> getContentTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Source
        Gets the ContentTypes that are currently stored by the Source. Notice the return object is a Set, meaning it returns all unique content types found in the Source without duplications.
        Specified by:
        getContentTypes in interface Source
        Returns:
        a Set of ContentTypes currently available from this Source.

      • getSourceStatus

        public ddf.catalog.util.impl.SourceStatus getSourceStatus()
        Returns the known SourceStatus of this Cached Source. The value represents the cached status of the last check for the source. It can either be available, unavailable, or never been tested (unchecked).
        Returns:
        The SourceStatus for this Source

      • checkStatus

        public void checkStatus()
        Updates the cached Source with the current status of the wrapped source. The wrapped source is tested to be available, and if it is available, the contentTypes will also be cached.

      • getAttributeValue

        public String getAttributeValue(String attr)
        Returns the value of an arbitrary attribute
        Parameters:
        attr - The attribute value requested
        Returns:
        The attribute Value
